verses.text: To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm of David. Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I wasin distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
O ye sons of men, how long will ye turnmy glory into shame? how longwill ye love vanity, andseek after falsehood? Selah.
But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call to him.
Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.
There aremany that say, Who will show us anygood? LORD, lift thou upon us the light of thy countenance.
Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time whentheir corn and their wine increased.
I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep; for thou only, LORD, makest me dwell in safety.
